alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:47PM EST until February 18 at 11:17PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Rough River near Dundee affecting Ohio County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rough River near Dundee. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, County roads between Dundee and Narrows flood. At 26.0 feet, County roads near Sunnydale flood. At 27.0 feet, KY 919 flood at Underwood and Clifty Huff Roads near Narrows. At 28.0 feet, Trailer courts in Hartford flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Friday the stage was 26.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM CST Friday was 26.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.6 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.1 feet on 06/29/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are affected by these crests take any necessary actions. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=lmk Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio and your local media for the latest information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued tomorrow morning.
